results.title: The Dingles
results.creator_credit: Les Drew, Bill Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Helen Levchuk, this animated short children’s film is the story of Doris Dingle and her three cat - Donna, Dayoh and Deedee - and their adventure one windy and rainy day. A funny and visually delightful for children aged three to ten and their parents. Illustrated by John Bianchi. (Awards: Chicago; San Francisco; New York) Also available on DVD [319319].

results.title: The Cat came back
results.creator_credit: Cordell Barker, Ches Yetman, Richard Condie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cordell Barker’s animated film is based on a century old folk song. Poor old Mr Johnson becomes increasingly manic as he tries and tries again to rid himself of a little yellow cat. His desperate attempts to find solitude become an obsession, with tragic consequences. Winner of the Special Jury Prize for Humor and Music at the 1988 World Festival of Animation in Zagreb. Fourteen awards, including Chicago; Shanghai; Quebec; Genie, Toronto; Oscar nomination.

results.title: King of the children = Hai tzu wang
results.creator_credit: Chen Kaige and Xi'an Film Studio
results.brief_description: The third feature by the director of “Yellow Earth” and “The Big Parade” is set in a remote forest area of Yunnen Province during the Cultural Revolution. A young man from the city, sent to the countryside in a work brigade, is chosen to be a teacher at a village school, despite his own lack of formal education. There he discovers an immense gap between the needs of his students and the culture he is required to offer them. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Wipe Out the Jargon
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: The characters in this madcap program (a pen, a pencil and liquid paper) spearhead an attack on jargon and woolly-writing. They demonstrate how to improve letter and report writing skills by isolating the four principles of clear, well structured letters and reports: Plan, Be Clear, Order, Evaluate. Short notes accompany the program.

results.title: Through the looking glass
results.creator_credit: Burbank Animation Sydney (Jointly) and Jambre Productions
results.brief_description: Alice has fallen through her mirror into a wonderful place called Chessland! There Tom Fool, the plucky magician, introduces her to the eccentric White Queen. Alice wants to be Queen too! However, first she must travel across 8 crazy squares of Chessland hitching rides on flying horses and trains that swim.

results.title: Looking into Databases: Developing with Dbase IV
results.brief_description: This program takes a new database user beyond the basics to an understanding of the meaning and operation of “relational” database systems. The narrator shows how a block diagram of a working library system can be developed and then using dBase 1V, “converted” into files and programs complete with modem menus.

results.title: Cary Grant: the leading man
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Suzette Winter and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Born Alexander Archibald Leech in Bristol, England 1904, the son of working class parents. Always interested in acting and the theatre, Cary rose to fame after being discovered by Mae West. Her confidence in the young man she befriended paid off when Cary overcame his humble beginnings to become a favourite Hollywood icon, whose resume of films include ‘Bringing Up Baby’, ‘An Affair to Remember’, ‘His Girl Friday’ and ‘North by Northwest’. This documentary highlights the highs and lows of his career and uses family photos, archival footage and clips from his films to show the many faces of one of Hollywood’s most admired male actors. Includes interviews with friends and colleagues including: Leslie Caron; Douglas Fairbanks Jr; Deborah Kerr; Eva Marie Saint; Ralph Bellamy; Stanley Donen; Richard Brooks and Stanley Kramer.

results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.

results.title: Shout! the story of Johnny O'keefe
results.brief_description: Johnny O’Keefe, the man who almost single-handedly created the Australian rock`n’roll industry. The man who challenged the Americans and broke all the rules, and whose reward was the devotion of millions of fans for a generation. This is the true story - all the triumphs and all the tears that drove the man forward and ultimately to his tragic, untimely death in 1978. A must for everyone who was there.

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: John Clark, Mark Egerton, Pom Oliver and Film Corporation of Western Australia
results.brief_description: A young man, Mike, has an obsession with cars and someone else’s girlfriend. The film concentrates on his struggle to win her, and survive the challenge of her mean boyfriend to a series of illegal street races. Cast includes Deborah Conway, Max Cullen and Richard Moir.
